channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2024060113
item.description:
Report E-2024060113

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-28T00:45:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-13
  • City: CREOLA
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 4
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: UPON ARRIVAL AT CONSIGNEE LOCATION OFFLOADING OPERATIONS STARTED. DUE TO A SLIGHT LEAK AT THE EXTERNAL VALVE CONNECTION CONSIGNEE PERSONEL REJECTED LOAD REQUIRING REPAIR AT OFF-SITE LOCATION. DRIVER PROCEEDED TO REPAIR FACILITY FOR ASSISTANCE. AT EVENT LOCATION, CTMV WAS BROUGHT TO DOORWAY OF REPAIR FACILITY DUE TO WEATHER CONDITIONS. DRIVER ATTEMPTED TO ASSIST MECHANICS BY REMOVING EXTERNAL VALVE FROM HOUSING. ONCE VALVE REMOVED FROM PIPE PRODUCT FLOWED FREELY INTO ENVIROMENT. DRIVER ATTEMPTED TO ACTUATE EMERGENCY SHUTOFF. ACTIVATION OF EMERGENCY SHUTOFF FAILED TO STOP FLOW OF PRODUCT. FACILITY EVACUATED DUE TO PRODUCT RELEASE AND INABILITY TO HAULT FLOW FROM TRAILER. VAPOR CLOUD RESULTED FROM PRODUCT FUMES AND WET WEATHER AT TIME OF INCIDENT. DRIVER SUFFERED CHEMICAL BURNS DURING ATTEMPT TO REMOVE VALVE AND HAULT FLOW, WAS TAKEN TO HOSPITAL. INTERNAL INVESTIGATION UNDERWAY CAUSE OF FAILURE AT THIS POINT APPEARS TO BE INTERNAL VALVE SEATING WHICH PREVENTED PROPER OPERATION OF INTERNAL VALVE SEALING VESSEL. SUPPLIMENTAL REPORT WILL BE FILED WITH ADDITIONAL DETAILS.

item.title: Report E-2024080581
item.description:
Report E-2024080581

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: BENSALEM
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 3ft-by-3ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that one hundred and fifty (150) gallons of material released from one (1) 330-gallon poly tote due to a forklift puncture. The remaining product was transferred to a new poly tote and deployed a neutralizer to the impacted area and then used granular absorbents. The spent material was recovered and containerized into five (5) 55-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024081403
item.description:
Report X-2024081403

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-18
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: During sort operations at the MSPA location a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. While investigating the shipment the spill agent found a glass bottle packaged with styrofaom molds top and bottom. The glas bottle was broken and all contents spilled inside of the fiberboard box. A packing slip inside identified the contents as dimethyl sulfoxide as a UN2810. There were no DG markings or paperwork on the outside of the fiberboard box. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Spill noticed in trailer prior to unloading, team recognized that half of a tote was missing and called our consultant Hazmat ONE. Team responded for cleanup and put all waste into three 55 gallon drums from the material that was cleaned up from the trailer and ground. No drains or soil was impacted.

item.title: Report E-2024080213
item.description:
Report E-2024080213

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-15
  • City: FERRISBURG
  • State: VT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG MERCHANT GAS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 735000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Merchant Gas Group, LLC unit was traveling on Route 7 in Ferrisburgh, Vermont. It is suspected that a fire started in one of the rear wheels on the tractor that quickly spread to the trailer. Due to the fire and heat, the trailer began to vent the natural gas it was holding. The local fire department was eventually able extinguish the fire. The tractor and trailer suffered significant damage as a result of the fire.
